posts.title: Holiday Singalong
posts.content:
You might discover a new holiday tradition at Big Box Karaoke after one night of singalongs, food, drinks, and fun. 

  • Gather: Big Box Karaoke has private boxes ready to rent out for large and small parties and is a great environment for all ages. As the only place like it in Northwest Arkansas, it’s a must try. 
  • Lounge: Enjoy a full bar and food menu with quality options served directly to your box so you can focus on being a star. There are over 70,000 songs available to choose from, and we’re betting your favorite is on the list. 

Click HERE to book your party.

posts.title: Underground
posts.content:
It really is time for the holiday fun to begin, because Undercroft has brought back Miracle on 2nd Street for its second annual run in Bentonville. 

  • Two spaces: Miracle is a speakeasy below The Preacher’s Son and is occupying its patio space as well throughout the season. The Preacher’s Son patio will be transformed into a winter wonderland, and Undercroft will be decked out in the Christmas theme we all love. 
  • Holiday magic: Miracle on 2nd Street is a “whimsical destination” ready with holiday drinks for everyone over 21. Guests who arrive will have access to both spaces so as to get the fullest experience. Reservations are open, so grab a slot!

Click HERE for more information.

posts.title: Outside The Box
posts.content:
Applications are open for a new program at The Collaborative, a University of Arkansas education and research center in Bentonville.

  • Preparing greatness: The Greenhouse Outdoor Recreation Program (GORP) was created to support outdoor recreation entrepreneurs with the resources they need to be successful. From workshops to mentorships to a co-working space, the program is ready to equip. 
  • Built for growth: The program is 12 weeks long and offers up to $15k in “non-dilutive funding” among other developmental services. The first GORP cohort will be held in the winter/spring of 2022. 

Apply and find more information HERE.

posts.title: Giving Back
posts.content:
It’s Giving Tuesday today and there are dozens of opportunities for you to give back to your community in Northwest Arkansas. 

  • Part of a family: Giving Tuesday is a worldwide celebration of generosity that takes the form of all sorts of acts of kindness. It could look like time, money, goods, advocacy, etc. There are both in person and online opportunities for those who wish to participate. 
  • A spectrum: The end of the year is an important time for nonprofits to raise money through donations, as they cannot do the work they do without community support. You can help nonprofits prevent sex trafficking, help students learn English online, and so much more.

Click HERE to find ways to give.

posts.title: A Stadium Tour
posts.content:
For the first time in over 7 years, Garth Brooks is coming to Arkansas.

  • One shot: The Donald W. Razorback Stadium is set to host Garth Brooks on Saturday, April 23 2022 for the first time ever, and it will be the only stadium appearance for Arkansas or Oklahoma on Brooks’ 2022 tour. 
  • Get seats: Concert tickets will be on sale at 10a on Friday, Dec 3 and will cost $94.95. It would be the perfect Christmas gift for the Garth Brooks lover of the family.

Get Tickets HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Happy century: An Arkansas newspaper turned 100 years old this year.
  • Dance: Way to go Golden Tamers on winning the state championship!
  • Increased presence: We're in for a third Lindsey & Associates location here in NWA.
  • Expanding: Olivia Walton is taking Crystal Bridges full steam ahead.
  • Theatre: And congrats to the FHS Thespian Group 717 for your accomplishment!
  • Telling your story: We've got a spot for you in our newsletter. Check out our ad deals HERE.
